Text: discovery and lists Cc Here is the discovery we tried to send out last week The people on the A list attachment A are the ones to whom the nonISO discovery is directed Ive made all the changes to the email list that I received this morning I think If you send names please indicate whether they are destined for the email list or the restricted service list Although we have ended up as custodians of both at least until we file the request for a restricted service list wed really like to avoid mixing up the names letter data requestwpd Instructions Definitionswpd Staff Data Request to ISOwpd staffdatarequest to generators in Attachment Awpd Attachment Awpd

issues list and cross examinationStaff is considering very broad categories buckets which might contain the issues in this proceeding that we might agree to give Judge Birchman Our list is attached Also Judge Birchman will probably ask us about cross examination times If possible it would be wise to be prepared with a time estimate either as a single entity or as a member of a group If thats not possible if you could prepare a list of witnesses you are not interested in crossing that might give him some indication that the December phase of the hearing could fit within the allotted time issues wpd

Re Fwd Re testimony filings listAs directed Date Fri Nov From Bruce Birchman To Jo Ann Scott Subject RE Fwd Re testimony filings list MimeVersion ContentType multipartmixed boundaryDADEFF please place on listserv Date Fri Nov From Bruce Birchman To Linda Palmateer Subject RE Fwd Re testimony filings list MimeVersion ContentType multipartalternative boundaryDADEFF For the benefit of all concerned and listserv Williams testimony was provided in a jumbled fashion in a large box which contains a cover letter to the Secretary that mentions there is being filed a redacted and unredacted version of Elliots testimony the box provided to me has no confidentiality markings on it and simply sasys Box of in the box is a CD with a label that says exhibits to testimony of Elliot and indicated those materials are protectedthe CD was not mentioned in the transmittal letter so withut opening it one does not know its contents also in the box without any markings tabbed items attached to that by a rubber band lare enghty spread sheets which on the first sheet indicvated that sheet is protected with remaining sheets covering heat rate data followed by another tab with items AF none of which is labelled as confidential and a further rubber banded tabbed items A through N None of this material except as noted is labelled confidential and it does not appear that Eliiotts testimony and the required detailed narrative sumary is among the hard copy mmaterial described above If the Secretary received this pottage I would be doubtful that its office understood what is protected and what is not Beyond that the brief summary of the Heintz testimony is inadequate and needs to be revised since it simply says he describes explains etc without providing the essence of the material or the material points In other words the filing as it was provided to me is haphazard and a mess and an explanation is in order togetether with proper provision tome of two tabbed hard copies of any testimony Willimans wishes to sponsor and a clear delineation of what is protected and what is not The same followup should be made with the Secretary in the event that Williams wishes to comply with the Protective Order and the Rules of Practice Linda Palmateer AM please see attached do you have what he is talking about

Fwd Need to Adjust Hearing ScheduleThe latest from Judge Birchman Received from wdcfercmsxfercgov by internet Tue Nov Received from wdcsmtpfercgov by wdcfercmsxfercgov with Microsoft SMTPSVC Tue Nov Received FROM internet BY wdcsmtpfercgov Tue Nov Received from WDCODOMAINMessageServer by internet with NovellGroupWise Tue Nov MessageId sccinternet XMailer Novell GroupWise Internet Agent Date Tue Nov From Bruce Birchman To Subject Need to Adjust Hearing Schedule MimeVersion ContentType multipartalternative boundaryDBDDBC ReturnPath XOriginalArrivalTime Nov UTC FILETIMEBDCB Please address this with the Listserv participants Hearing on probably should be avoided because of distractions likely to intrude in the sound system from a holiday party at the Commission which I have just learned will involve all offices and most floors Rather than keep witnesses over until and have a day of hearing on that day and as we will be in hearing on c issues on I would offer the following suggestion Hold days of hearing on issue on as planned reschedule the hearings for and to and or and then hear the c issues as planned on Initial and reply brief dates of and would remain unchanged as would the remainder of the trial schedule I am open to other suggestions and would like to retain as much as possible the bifurcated trial schedule process

Re ELAEPCO Responses public version of AEPCOs filingGot it SHPCCOM PM Before I started having my on email problems today I told Robert Rosenberg of Slover Loftus that I would see if I could successfully distribute his Wednesday Nov message and attachments through the EL listserv Thus I am giving it a try However as I look at the attachments one is plus megs I will send that one separately I might guess that it size is a problem except that many large files have made it through previously The file that is coming separately is named trlpdf Below is the text of his original message Attached are attachments hi provided me separately but which were supposed to go with that message Thanks From EL List mailto On Behalf Of Robert Rosenberg Sent Wednesday November PM To ELLISTSERVGSAGOV Subject EL public version of AEPCOs filing Attached are the items that Arizona Electric Power Cooperative Inc AEPCO filed today in response to Judge Birchmans order on confidentiality transmittal letter testimony summary same as before AEP redacted AEP made public in its entirety AEP made public in its entirety and certificate of service Hardcopy no CD is also being mailed to the restricted service list Channing Channing D Strother Jr McCarthy Sweeney Harkaway PC K Street NW Ste Washington DC Phone x Fax EMail Pager

rebuttal testimony schedule clarificationThe September order had established December as the date for Simultaneous rebuttal testimony on November evidentiary presentations On November several parties had filed responsive testimony on issues relating to other sources of cost recovery including NOx emissions and startup costs The November order said these issues will be addressed at the February hearing on issues and This combination left Staff uncertain as to when rebuttal testimony on these issues is to be filed We called Bryan Clark Judge Birchmans new law clerk and asked when we are to file rebuttal testimony He checked with Judge Birchman and said we are to file all rebuttal testimony on these issues on February

Fwd URGENT FERC MESSAGEA warning from our IT peopleand why FERC had no email for a couple of h ours Date Tue Dec From IT Support Center To ercfedus er cfedus BH erc fedus DCiemielews us us elizabeth jasonchen fercfedus JJe dus jonathanburg us us e rcfedus MartinWVan s PHairston fercfedus erc fedus erc fedus steve s erc fedus e rcfedus Subject URGENT FERC MESSAGE MimeVersion ContentType multipartalternative boundaryDDABE A new virus was released today This high risk virus is called WGONER MM All incoming and outgoing internet email has been temporarily shut d own at FERC in order to prevent this virus from infecting workstations If you have received any email with the Subject Hi containing an attachme nt entitled GONESCR please delete it immediately and empty your Trash I f you need assistance with this please call the IT Support Center immedia tely at Once this issue has been resolved internet mail service will be restored Another notice will be sent at that time notifying you that this problem has been corrected Thank you

service without mailIn light of the Commissions September Public Notice on CIPS no docket number stating that FERC has not been receiving mail since October and the fact that a lot of other mail service has been intermittent one of the parties asked if responses to your October order in this proceeding could be served on listserv rather than by mail If you hit reply all it should go to all the parties on the listserv

Re question about notice SMOCOM PM Could staff please confirm from the Judge that filing electronically with the list serve will suffice for notice That depends on what you are noticing Discovery is not to be filed with the Commission and the parties can agree to serve it electronically If something has to be filed with the Commission it has to be filed If the filing is in a proceeding in which an ALJ has instituted a restricted service list service on that restricted service list is enough If the filing covers a bunch of dockets some of which do not have restricted service lists or is going directly to the Commission youre stuck with serving the whole official unrestricted service list Finally in my unofficial opinion as a practical matter considering the rate at which mail is moving around Washington DC these days use of the listserv may be the only way to give timely notice no matter what the rules say If you have a specific kind of notice in mind Ill be glad to pass it on to Judge Birchman or you can send it to Bruce ERCFEDUS with a cc to the listserv which is what I would do

rebuttal testimony schedule clarificationThe September order had established December as the date for Simultaneous rebuttal testimony on November evidentiary presentations On November several parties had filed responsive testimony on issues relating to other sources of cost recovery including NOx emissions and startup costs The November order said these issues will be addressed at the February hearing on issues and This combination left Staff uncertain as to when rebuttal testimony on these issues is to be filed We called Bryan Clark Judge Birchmans new law clerk and asked when we are to file rebuttal testimony He checked with Judge Birchman and said we are to file all rebuttal testimony on these issues on February

The parties to Docket No EL had a onehour phone call this afternoon to discuss ways to idThe parties to Docket No EL had a onehour phone call this afternoon to discuss ways to identify material for which it is appropriate to lift the protective order The ISO is prepared to release all claims for protection except for certain gas data which comes from a commercial gas index service The ISO is negotiating with that company to allow release of those data Many of the participants who filed material under seal did so because their exhibits were based on claims of privilege by the ISO or other parties All parties who have submitted material under seal will send to the ISO by Wednesday November COB East Coast time a list of their claims of privilege They will state whether the claim is derivative ie it is based on a sources claim of privilege if it is not derivative whether the protective order can be lifted or whether they are still claiming protection for the material By Friday Nov the ISO will circulate a list to the judge and the participants showing the material for which protection is and is not still claimed The participants who file rebuttal testimony will be prepared to explain the basis for any claims of protection for the rebuttal testimony in the conference on December The participants will also use best efforts to identify by December any documents which they plan to use for crossexamination which may be subject to claims of protection
